alert.note: Alert for Beaufort (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 09 at 7:19AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Georgia and southeast South Carolina, including the following areas, in southeast Georgia, Coastal Bryan, Coastal Chatham, Coastal Liberty, Coastal McIntosh, Inland Bryan, Inland Chatham, Inland Liberty and Inland McIntosh. In southeast South Carolina, Beaufort, Charleston, Coastal Colleton and Coastal Jasper. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - The National Weather Service in Charleston has issued a Flood Watch for the coastal counties of southeast Georgia and the Lowcountry of South Carolina. Rounds of showers and thunderstorms will result in 2 to 4 inches of rainfall across the coastal areas today into this evening. Some areas could see rainfall totals in excess of 4 inches. Moderate to heavy rainfall rates are possible during the high tide this morning, between 6 AM to 9 AM, and again during the high tide this evening, between 6 PM to 10 PM. Flooding may be exacerbated at coastal locations during the times of high tide, especially along the South Carolina coast this evening. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
